timeline.bodyText: oh nice, I like this much better now
timeline.author: evacchi

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we reintroduce the check for native compilation here.
timeline.author: mariofusco

replies.bodyText: No as the purpose of this is to enable native compilation with the accumulate
replies.author: lucamolteni

timeline.bodyText:
@lucamolteni Probably you want to call clearProperty() ? Btw, setting "false" wouldn't work because it's evaluated with null or not.
https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/blob/master/drools-core/src/main/java/org/drools/core/base/CoreComponentsBuilder.java#L26
timeline.author: tkobayas

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if it would make sense to keep it as part of the test / support library for tests (but I get this is probably here to make it available to the wider code/test-base)
timeline.author: evacchi

timeline.bodyText:
What about promote/document this interface? As far as I can see, implement this interface is the only way to write a
"programmatic" lambda with a stable fingerprint.

timeline.bodyText: Considering that are not instance methods and are used only for testing I would prefer to move them to a NativeImageTestUtils or similar directly inside drools-test-coverage module. Wdyt?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: What about rename print() method to highlight this introspection behavior? Something like getIntrospectedFingerprint
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
TBH I find print clearer than  getIntrospectedFingerprint as this effectively prints a string representation of a lambda such as
ALOAD 0
INVOKEVIRTUAL org/drools/modelcompiler/domain/Person.getAge()I
INVOKESTATIC java/lang/Integer.valueOf(I)Ljava/lang/Integer;
replies.author: lucamolteni

timeline.bodyText: Is this stable? Any EntryPointNode can be used?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: yes, this test never failed us
replies.author: lucamolteni

timeline.bodyText:
What about a log (trace) message for each branch? I don't know how often this method is invoked but the value is already cached so I expect almost no overhead.
The main reason for this comment is that based on this simple toString value node sharing could be disabled so it could have a global perf impact
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText:
@lucamolteni I'm curious.
Can you perhaps explain what do I need to do with my lambdas to end up in this branch? Obviously, if possible, I'd love node sharing even in native mode.
timeline.author: triceo

replies.author: lucamolteni

timeline.bodyText: Minor improvement: instead of generating a random UUID maybe in this case we could simply return super.toString(). In this way it should return something like org.drools.model.functions.IntrospectableLambda@b268bb07, i.e. the name of the class followed by the memory address, and in this way we will keep the node sharing in case of 2 constraints using the same lambda instance (not sure if this could happen in reality though).
timeline.author: mariofusco

replies.bodyText: It can certainly happen in Constraint Streams, which may use the same predicate in multiple rules w/ the executable model.
replies.author: triceo

timeline.message: method to set the native image property
added dependency of drools-core to drools-canonical-model
Use toString instead of random UUID
Use toString instead of random UUID
